activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#13372
activity.text:
Hi @Jacobjeevan , @rithviknishad
I would like to work on this issue. kindly assign this issue

Root Cause of the issue :
The encounters query lacks sorting parameters, returning encounters in default order (creation date) without prioritizing active encounters. The default "ALL STATUS" view shows unsorted encounters, forcing nursing staff to scroll through entire lists to locate active patients, especially problematic for long-term ICU patients.

Solution:
Add Status-Based Sorting: Implement sorting logic that prioritizes active encounters ( in_progress, planned) at the top, followed by completed/discharged encounters
Modify Query Parameters: Add ordering parameter to API call with custom sort logic for "all status" view
Change Default View: Consider defaulting to "Active" status instead of "All Status" to reduce clicks
Client-Side Sorting: If API doesn't support custom sorting, implement client-side sorting by status priority

ETA:1day

Root Cause of this issue :
The PrintPaymentReconciliation component uses raw HTML table elements ( <table>, <thead>, <tbody>, <th>, <td>) instead of the Shadcn Table components that are used consistently throughout the rest of the application, creating styling and component usage inconsistencies.

Solution:
Import Shadcn Table Components: Add imports for Table, TableHeader, TableBody, TableHead, TableRow, TableCell from @/components/ui/table
Replace Raw HTML: Convert both table instances (lines 140-150 and 175-185) to use Shadcn components
Maintain Layout: Keep existing styling classes and data structure unchanged
Preserve Print Styling: Ensure print-specific styles remain intact

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#13474
activity.text:
Hi @Jacobjeevan @rithviknishad
I would like to work on this issue, could you kindly assign me this issue.

Root Cause of issue :
The locations query uses pagination with ITEMS_PER_PAGE = 12, limiting data fetching to only 12 locations per page. When facilities have 100+ locations, the map view only receives the current page's 12 locations instead of all available locations, causing most locations to be missing from the map display.

Approach:
Separate Query for Map: Create a dedicated query for map view that fetches all locations without pagination limits
Increase Limit for Map: Use a much higher limit (e.g., 1000) or remove pagination entirely for map data
Conditional Fetching: Detect map view and modify query parameters to fetch complete dataset
Remove Filtering: Disable mine: true, mode: kind filters that may exclude locations from map view

ETA: 1day

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#13541
activity.text:
@Jacobjeevan @rithviknishad  i would like to work on this issue could you kindly assign me ...

Root Cause of issue:
The button uses navigate(sourceUrl) where sourceUrl comes from query parameters that can be lost, modified, or become invalid during the invoicing workflow. After invoice operations complete, the original sourceUrl parameter may no longer exist or point to a valid route.

Proposed Solution:
Add URL Validation: Check if sourceUrl exists and is a valid internal route before navigation
Implement Fallback: Use goBack() as fallback when sourceUrl is invalid or missing
Sanitize URL: Ensure sourceUrl starts with '/' to prevent external redirects
Improve Button Logic: Make button text determination more robust

ETA: 1day
